14. A bond that is trading at $1,058 and makes annual coupon payments that sum to
$50 has a current yield of 50 / 1,058 = 4.726%.
The yield to maturity (YTM) of a bond, on an annual basis, is the effective annual
yield and is used for bonds that pay an annual coupon. For bonds that pay coupons
semiannually, we often quote the YTM on a semiannual basis, that is, two times the
effective semiannual yield. To compare the yields of two bonds, we must calculate their
YTMs on the same basis.
